sub_title: Designer at Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam (VU Amsterdam)
summary:
I consider myself a creative person who thinks differently and works really hard. I am happy when I am a part of a group that makes breakthroughs. I believe 'challenging' means 'fun' and I try to adjust this in my life. 
I love communicating with people and writing. I am passionate design. It gives me great energy when I create innovative and imaginary worlds from scratch.

education.field_of_study: Computer Science Software Engineering, Structural Biology and Bioinformatics

awards.title: Tech girl for the Month December 2016
awards.description:
Een nieuwe week, een nieuwe Techgirl in ons middelpunt! En niet zomaar iemand: deze front-ender bij Philips maakt kinderen enthousiast voor programmeren. Ze nam het initiatief voor deelname van Philips Nederland bij het wereldwijde project ‘Hour of Code‘. Techgirl Marina Milo maakt zich niet voor niets sterk om kinderen te leren programmeren. Daarover lees je meer in onderstaand verhaal!

http://www.techgirl.nl/programmeren-is-net-zo-belangrijk-als-een-tweede-taal/

awards.title: VU Fellowship Programme (VUFP) 2011-2012
awards.description: The VU Fellowship Programme (VUFP) offers talented prospective students the unique opportunity to pursue a degree in a selection of Master’s programmes at VU University. VU University has committed to providing approximately 1 million euro towards attracting highly motivated, excellent students.

profile_positions.title: Junior Lecturer

profile_positions.description:
From March 2016, I joined the Philips Graduate Program in Healthcare. I am part of the front end team and apart from being a junior front-end developer, I also facilitated the following roles.

A) Support the Technical Lead role:
      i) prepare presentations to show to the Head of the Department, 
     ii) make proposals for the best way of working within the Team

B) Support the Product Owner role:
      i) coordinating teams and prepare gap analysis,
     ii) aligning among different parties/teams

C) Support the Scrum Master role:
      i) initiating & organising meetings for group decision making
     ii) create, organise and promote social events for the Department in order to have a comfortable working multi-cultural environment
 
D) EVENT PLANNING in Philips, CDP2

i) Hour of Code Event December 2016 with three dutch schools in Eindhoven:
     - Initiate, organise, promote, set-up meetings with involved parties
     - Teach programming to the students (aged 8-14) during the event.
     - Co-host, create certificates for the students, print and distribute

ii) Multicultural Christmas Lunch and Video Event
    - Initiate, organise event
    - Promote event
    - Set-up meetings with involved parties,
    - Coordinate with involved parties and share objectives of each party involved
    - Able to mutli-task under pressure

profile_positions.title: Top Engineer IT Program

profile_positions.description:
This summer internship was amazing. Within a group of 4, we solved a strategic client case, with the support, expertise and backing of one of the world's leading technology companies. Extreme Blue at IBM It's 12 weeks of intense creative thinking and I simply loved it.

I had the role of the Product Owner and of the Scrum Master.
•	Translate business requirements into System/Functional and software Requirements
•	Gather internal/external customer input, stakeholder input and translate them to epics and features
•	Effectively communicate and align with external clients and internal teams in order to deliver
•	Be part of a scrum team and work closely on the backlog
•	Be part of (Grooming, planning, stand-ups, retrospectives etc.)
•	Assist in the communication with stakeholders/clients and manage their expectations
•	Create final video for presentation with clients
•	Arrange necessary meetings with team and stakeholders.
•	Facilitate in the Grooming, planning, stand-ups and retrospectives.
profile_positions.title: EXTREME BLUE INTERNSHIP

profile_positions.description:
Master Thesis Project: "Benchmarking and improving algorithms for crossing schedule optimization".

The project was based on the previous work of my supervisor, Mohammed El-Kebir. He introduced and described several algorithms for solving the crossing schedule optimization problem.  Among these methods, two were compared (Dynamic Programming, Integer Linear Programming) in terms of performance on a benchmark dataset consisting of simulated instances.

In my project, the two existing methods are being compared on the same problem benchmarks in order to find the optimal solution.  The  main goal of the project is to improve the dynamic method and to compare the two algorithms for a second time. The computational results are presented and analysed for reporting the efficiency of the two algorithms. 

The project combines programming skills in python and in C++, statistical skills for comprehending the computational results and data analysis.
profile_positions.title: Internship (Thesis)

profile_positions.description:
In Amsterdam I have been tutoring students in Computer Science Courses, Mathematics and English Cources. It had been one of the best experiences in my life. I had the following tasks:

•	Tutoring university students.
•	Presenting and coordinating StudentTutors at monthly meetups.
•	Providing technical support to students (online/offline) who experience problem with
        StudentTutors.nl via telephone or email.
•	Conducting and evaluating weekly reports and projects of students.
•	Guiding and facilitating new tutors.
•	Dealing with complaints concerning students or other tutors.
•	Coordinating students’ requirements to ensure effective tutoring support.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Programming, Mathematics, English Courses

volunteer_experiences.role: Teaching programming to children in orphanages in Greece and Albania
volunteer_experiences.description: I visited with a group of friends orphanages in Greece and in Albania in order to teach children basic programming. By teaching programming to children and to teenagers, you invest for their future and you give them a weapon to fight the unemployment they might find in the future. We are trying to help them discover a new world, the world of coding.
